Requiring Volunteer Work for Graduation.professor_prompt: This week we discussed the fact that in some education systems, doing volunteer work is a requirement for graduation from high school. That is, students would not receive their high school diplomas until they provide evidence of doing volunteer work to serve their community; for example, they might distribute food to the needy and document how many hours they spent doing that. In your post, discuss whether you agree or disagree with the idea of requiring volunteer work for graduation and why you feel that way.
Requiring Volunteer Work for Graduation.student_1_response: While volunteering is important, I do not think requiring it is acceptable. An integral part of volunteering is one's willingness to sacrifice time and effort for the good of others without expecting a reward. If volunteering becomes a requirement, it loses that essential quality of not expecting a reward—because there would be a reward, namely, graduation.
Requiring Volunteer Work for Graduation.student_2_response: While I agree with parts of Claire's argument, I like the idea of making volunteering a requirement. By having students practice the act of volunteering during high school, even if it is required and not merely out of goodwill, it will become a part of their lives that they will continue doing after they graduate.
Requiring Volunteer Work for Graduation.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working.topic: Pursuing an Advanced Degree While Working Full-time
Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working.professor_prompt: This week, we'll be talking about continuing education. Many people who have university degrees and work full-time jobs want to deepen their knowledge and skills. Some of them decide to continue their education by enrolling in advanced degree programs, such as master's or doctorate programs. Do you think that it is a good idea to pursue an advanced degree while continuing to work full-time? Why or why not?
Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working.student_1_response: I think it's better to stop working and become a full-time student. It's challenging to combine a full-time job and studies, and one may easily fall behind. Focus on one thing at a time and do it well rather than try to do both and do neither very well. Overextending yourself can lead to disappointment.
Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working.student_2_response: I think it is a good idea to study for an advanced degree while continuing to work full-time. Some of my friends took that path. One advantage, they told me, was that what they had learned in class they could use at work right away, and their coworkers were very impressed.
Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working.folder_name: Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working Full-time？
Pursue An Advanced Degree While Working.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Making Purchasing Decisions.professor_prompt: Let's continue talking about consumer behavior. We have been discussing different ways people go about choosing what products to buy, and there are many potential sources of information and advice for consumers. In your opinion, which is the better strategy for making purchasing decisions, relying on advice from friends and family, or depending on information from online sources? Why?
Making Purchasing Decisions.student_1_response: I believe depending on online sources is the better strategy for making purchasing decisions. The internet provides access to numerous reviews, ratings, and detailed product comparisons that friends and family simply cannot match. When I researched my last laptop online, I found comprehensive specifications and user experiences that helped me make an informed choice. Online resources offer objectivity and a wider range of opinions from actual product users.
Making Purchasing Decisions.student_2_response: Asking friends and family members for product recommendations might seem like an easier option, but it might take too much time to get all the information you need. An internet search would be much more efficient. There are many consumer magazines available online that compile lots of data to compare the advantages and disadvantages of one product versus another. The last time I bought a computer, I just watched a few videos online to make a decision, and now I regret that. My friends could have advised me better because they know my preferences and the kind of features that I am interested in. Consumers should get advice from the people around them to find the most suitable products.
Making Purchasing Decisions.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Requiring First-year Students to Take A.topic: Requiring First-year Students to Take A Course on Good Study Habits
Requiring First-year Students to Take A.professor_prompt: This week, we'll be learning about different ways to help students develop good study skills. Let's begin by discussing the following situation. According to administrators at some universities, first-year students often arrive with poor study skills. These administrators believe that the best way to address the situation is to require all first-year students to take a course on good study habits. Do you agree that this requirement is a good idea? Why or why not?
Requiring First-year Students to Take A.student_1_response: I support requiring all first-year students to attend a course on good study habits. Even basic skills such as how to take good notes are very important for succeeding in university studies, and I don't think all students acquire these skills while in high school. Many students would benefit from learning or refreshing these skills in a required course.
Requiring First-year Students to Take A.student_2_response: In my view, such a course should not be a university requirement. The efforts to improve study skills should begin in high school instead. That seems more appropriate. If you don't have well-developed academic skills by the time you get to university, perhaps you're not properly prepared.
Requiring First-year Students to Take A.folder_name: Requiring First-year Students to Take A Course on Good Study Habits
Requiring First-year Students to Take A.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Limiting Teaching of Fictional Texts.topic: Education: Teaching Fiction vs. Nonfiction Texts
Limiting Teaching of Fictional Texts.professor_prompt: Some educators think that in our global, tech-oriented world, students need to focus on nonfiction texts, such as news stories, technical manuals, or other informational materials. They say that reading poetry, novels, and short stories is not the optimal use of the limited time that students have in the classroom. How do you view this approach to education? Should schools limit the teaching of fictional texts in favor of teaching more practical, nonfiction texts?
Limiting Teaching of Fictional Texts.student_1_response: In my point of view, I believe that the school should also provide students with the opportunity of learning literature and analyzing fictional texts. First, it is true that students who have chosen scientific fields of study could easily find their ideal occupations in the future, but studying literature would also enable students to find a wide range of jobs. For example, literature majors could choose to become editors or writers in the publishers; they could also choose to become reporters because they are more skillful in delivering messages of ideas orally; they could also become teachers and impart knowledge to other students. Therefore, studying literature would also help students find suitable jobs in the future. Besides, learning fictional texts would enable students to develop a good reading habit, increasing their interest in terms of reading books.
Limiting Teaching of Fictional Texts.student_2_response: From my point of view, schools should teach more practical, nonfiction texts. Firstly, practical texts are more useful in job hunting than fiction texts do, since practical texts would solely focus on providing knowledge and theories that can be applied to people's future work. Therefore, schools need to offer students practical knowledge in order to provide a chance for them to secure ideal jobs. Especially, in these days, there are lots of people craving for one job now and one person needs to be truly outstanding enough so that he or she needs to have the practical skills that can be used immediately in the workplace. Fiction may be enjoyable, but it does not prepare students for the realities of the job market.
Limiting Teaching of Fictional Texts.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Effects of Society Progress Happening To.topic: Speed of Scientific and Technological Progress
Effects of Society Progress Happening To.professor_prompt: In the past, progress in science and technology was generally slow. However, in recent decades, the pace of scientific and technological progress has increased dramatically, with new discoveries and inventions being developed almost every day. Some people think that this rapid progress in science and technology is beneficial for society overall and should be encouraged. Others believe this progress is happening too quickly and could create serious problems. Which view do you agree with, and why?
Effects of Society Progress Happening To.student_1_response: The faster discoveries are made, the better. Thanks to advances in medicine, for example, our lives are so much better than those of our great-great-grandparents. Back then, life expectancy was much shorter because of a lack of medicines that today are inexpensive and widely available. Anyone with a serious medical condition hopes for rapid scientific progress.
Effects of Society Progress Happening To.student_2_response: In my opinion, I believe that this progress is happening too fast and could have serious concerns. First, because these new technologies are not well developed yet, many negative impacts that people haven't thought about could exist. Our development of technology happened just a few hundred years ago, and it is still developing in a very fast speed. These will raise many concerns such as environmental issues, things could damage human health such as radiation and many more. Just like what happened during the Industrial Revolution, when people couldn't foresee the impact of greenhouse gases. Therefore, these underdeveloped and new technologies would cause more damage to people in the future if these rate isn't going to slow down. Furthermore, conflicts caused by technology are increasing, too. Due to the production of more variety of products, more and more resources are needed, which further forces the countries to fight over a certain raw material. For example, the conflict element, which are rare elements that are located in less developed countries causes forced labor, war, and serious human rights issues.
Effects of Society Progress Happening To.folder_name: Effects of Society Progress Happening Too Quickly
Effects of Society Progress Happening To.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Raising the cost of Fuel for Cars.topic: Raising Fuel Costs to Reduce Air Pollution
Raising the cost of Fuel for Cars.professor_prompt: Your professor is teaching a class on economics. Write a post responding to the professor's question. In your response, you should do the following: Express and support your opinion. Make a contribution to the discussion in your own words. An effective response will contain at least 100 words. Dr. Achebe Today, we will examine what economists call incentives—the motivations that lead people to make certain choices. Cost is a major category of economic incentives. People tend to change their behavior when a particular choice gets more expensive. Let's discuss an example. Some economists argue that a good way to reduce air pollution is for governments to raise the cost (through taxes or other means) of fuel for cars. Do you agree or disagree with this viewpoint?
Raising the cost of Fuel for Cars.student_1_response: I think it would be a good idea to raise fuel prices. Making it more expensive to drive cars would cause many people to choose public transportation or use bicycles instead. In my city, they've just added bicycle lanes to all of the major roads. So, it would be easy to give up driving.
Raising the cost of Fuel for Cars.student_2_response: I disagree. Why should individuals be punished with such an added expense in their daily lives? The argument for a consumer fuel tax makes the assumption that cars are the biggest source of air pollution, and we need to question if that's an accurate assumption.
Raising the cost of Fuel for Cars.folder_name: Raising the cost of Fuel for Cars
Raising the cost of Fuel for Cars.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Chi.topic: Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Children
Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Chi.professor_prompt: This semester, we are studying how children learn and what influences their cognitive development. We know that children are affected both positively and negatively by what they see and hear. Many parents allow their children to watch entertaining or educational videos on devices like smartphones or tablets. Overall, do you think watching a lot of online videos is harmful to children? Why or why not?
Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Chi.student_1_response: I think watching online videos is harmful to children. Children under two years old need to develop communication skills by interacting with other people; passively watching videos exposes them to language, but it's not the same. Also, even for older children, sitting and staring at a device means they are not moving and exercising. I agree with Andrew that very young children who are learning to communicate should not watch a lot of videos. However, for children who are past that stage, videos can be great. Lots of kids' videos are about animals and nature. Most kids will never see a whale in its natural environment, but online, they can learn all about whales.
Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Chi.student_2_response: From my point of view, young children shouldn't be exposed to online videos. First of all, watching online videos is not good for children's eyes. Since young children's eyes are still not fully developed and sensitive to long-term exposure to screens, the use of electronic devices will increase the risk of shortsightedness for young children, which will be clearly a significant drawback for their future life. Although some may argue that young children should be allowed to watch educational videos, the truth is that children's eye will be harmed by the screen of electronic devices regardless of what video they watch. In addition, addition to electronic devices is another crucial problem. Nowadays lots of apps have the mechanism that could send you the video that you'd like to watch, and children are likely to become indulged in it since their self-discipline skills are still not fully developed.
Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Chi.folder_name: Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Children？
Watching Online Videos Is Harmful to Chi.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

TV or books.professor_prompt: Today, we're taking a look at the lasting effect of traditional media in our current society. Despite the emergence of digital platforms, traditional media such as television and books continue to have significant influence, shaping perspectives and opinions. In your view, is TV more important, or do books have a bigger effect on people in today's world? Share your thoughts and explain why you think that way.
TV or books.student_1_response: Books play a major role in our modern world because they offer specialized and in-depth knowledge. TV may give us the basics or a broad overview, but books really dig deep into various subjects, offering a full understanding and expert insights. This lets readers see different viewpoints and helps them think more critically. As a result, they can form well-rounded opinions based on comprehensive information.
TV or books.student_2_response: From my perspective, TV has a greater impact on people's live in today's world. To begin with, more people prefer watching TV. Nowadays, with the development of Internet, almost everyone has a television in his or her home. During the free time, all people would choose watching TV as their best way of finding relaxation because it contains variety of recreational channels like argument channel, cartoon channel, shopping channel and so on. Through browsing through the TV, people sooth their pressure. On the contrary, reading books tend to further take people's energy because it's impossible to read without thinking, making it less appeal when it comes to free time. Besides, TV could benefit people's real life. Many of the TV channels contain advertisements, which are likely to encounter people's need. For example, my uncle has found his job when he noticed the employment advertisement on TV. However, books could not provide such realistic aid, but instead, they tend to be merely a form of escaping from the reality by indulging into a fictional world.
TV or books.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Poor Eating Habit to Change.professor_prompt: To continue our discussion of the health benefits of good nutrition, I'd like you to consider the broader topic of eating habits—not just what people eat and drink, but how often, how much, and when. Those who want to improve their health often begin by changing some kind of eating habit. This includes a wide range of behavior. What is one poor eating habit that would be important for most people to change, and why?
Poor Eating Habit to Change.student_1_response: If people could start with one change to improve their eating habits, it would be to eat a better breakfast. Most people are so rushed in the morning that they don't take the time to sit down and eat a balanced meal. A good breakfast gives you more energy all day and keeps you from eating too much later on.
Poor Eating Habit to Change.student_2_response: I think most people don't bother to learn much about the food that they eat. This ignorance is a kind of bad eating habit. It can be burdensome, but you should try to read every food package label. The more you can learn about what you're putting in your body, the more likely you'll be to make good decisions.
Poor Eating Habit to Change.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Lecturing Is An Effective Teaching Metho.topic: Teaching Methods: Lecturing vs. Interactive Learning
Lecturing Is An Effective Teaching Metho.professor_prompt: One traditional method of classroom instruction is lecturing. Lecturing involves the teacher talking about a topic for an extended period of time and expecting students to learn by listening attentively. Today, some educators believe that teachers should limit how much time they spend lecturing and instead teach by encouraging in-class discussions and having students work in groups. However, some teachers still teach primarily by lecturing. Do you believe lecturing is an effective teaching method? Why or why not?
Lecturing Is An Effective Teaching Metho.student_1_response: I think lecturing can be effective. Some teachers can explain even complex concepts by telling interesting stories and by providing memorable examples. When teachers lecture in an entertaining way, students enjoy attending class and feel motivated to learn. Whether a teacher's lectures are effective depends on the teacher.
Lecturing Is An Effective Teaching Metho.student_2_response: In my opinion, lecturing is mainly ineffective because a teacher who only gives lectures can't know what's going on in students' minds. When a teacher lectures and students are just required to sit there, the teacher can't really check if students understand the lecture. Students have to contribute somehow to show whether or not they are learning. Active participation through discussions and group work allows teachers to identify misconceptions immediately and adjust their instruction accordingly. Relying solely on lectures creates a passive learning environment where students may become disengaged and retain less information.
Lecturing Is An Effective Teaching Metho.folder_name: Lecturing Is An Effective Teaching Method？
Lecturing Is An Effective Teaching Metho.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Living in One Town or City All Your Life.topic: Living in One Town or City All Your Life
Living in One Town or City All Your Life.professor_prompt: Today, I'd like to discuss choices people make in terms of where they decide to live. Some people choose to spend their entire lives in one town or city. Others leave their hometowns and might even move several times from one town or city to another. I'd like to get your thoughts on this subject. Do you think it is better to live in one town or city all your life? Why or why not?
Living in One Town or City All Your Life.student_1_response: Living in one place your whole life is the better option. It allows you to form strong bonds with neighbors and members of your community. You know that if you stay in one place for a long time, you will always have friends you can rely on when you need help. Moving from one city to another has some advantages. Adapting to different situations is an important skill to have in life, and moving forces a person to develop this skill. Having to make new friends and start over in a new city is a challenging exercise that builds character.
Living in One Town or City All Your Life.student_2_response: In my opinion, I believe living in various cities in my life would be a better idea than just dwelling in one place for our eternity. To begin with, constantly moving in other regions would bring us benefits in large scales. For instance, moving to new towns render the possibility of gaining the chance to become familiar with local residents. Thus, we would have the opportunity to befriend with them and learn about their cultures as well as life experience. Admittedly, some people recon that continuous transporting to other places might force us to abandon the strong bonds we have created with our neighbors. Nevertheless, the advanced technological development such as online video phones calls would still allow for constant connection between us and our old acquaintance. Such action would also enable us to assume new vocations in the new environment, meaning a whole new world waiting for us to explore.
Living in One Town or City All Your Life.folder_name: Living in One Town or City All Your Life
Living in One Town or City All Your Life.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Developing Soft Skills - Nonacademic Ski.professor_prompt: This week, we'll examine issues in education reform. For example, some educators think that by focusing mainly on foundational knowledge in subjects like reading, math, and science, schools are not fully preparing students for success in the workplace. These educators argue that soft skills — nonacademic skills such as being empathetic or having a strong work ethic — should be part of the curriculum, with classroom time dedicated to developing these skills. Do you agree? Why or why not?
Developing Soft Skills - Nonacademic Ski.student_1_response: I agree. While students need a strong foundation in academic subjects, soft skills are important because they affect how well students do their work. If classroom time is set aside for these skills, students will take them seriously and their academic work will benefit. Teachers could design lessons so that students learn about a skill and then do role-playing activities with classmates.
Developing Soft Skills - Nonacademic Ski.student_2_response: Soft skills are important, but I don't agree with using classroom time to work on them. I'm not sure how teachers would measure students' progress in developing these skills. If students' progress can't be measured on something being taught, I'm not sure if there's any point to teaching it.
Developing Soft Skills - Nonacademic Ski.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Hire Experienced Veterans Or Younger Emp.topic: Hiring for New Businesses: Experienced Veterans vs. Younger Employees
Hire Experienced Veterans Or Younger Emp.professor_prompt: We've been talking about the process of starting a new business. One of the most important aspects of the process is staffing—that is, deciding which people to hire. Please discuss the following question: Is it better for new businesses to hire experienced veterans of the industry or to staff the business with younger employees who are right out of university? Why do you think so?
Hire Experienced Veterans Or Younger Emp.student_1_response: I think a company should staff a business with the most experienced employees possible. If you're starting a new business, you need people around you who know what they are doing and can get the business up to speed fast. Spending time training inexperienced people will slow you down.
Hire Experienced Veterans Or Younger Emp.student_2_response: I understand what Claire is saying, but if you are starting a new business, you want people who are particularly enthusiastic and energetic. Who better than a recent graduate to bring those qualities to the job? You would be guaranteed an ambitious hard worker.
Hire Experienced Veterans Or Younger Emp.folder_name: Hire Experienced Veterans Or Younger Employees
Hire Experienced Veterans Or Younger Emp.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Governments Should Not Keep Scientific D.professor_prompt: This week's course materials will focus on scientific discoveries. While scientific researchers usually prefer to share what they learn with other scientists, many businesses and governments keep certain scientific discoveries secret. Some people believe that all scientific discoveries should be shared freely among scientists all around the world and that governments and businesses should not keep any discoveries secret. What do you believe and why?
Governments Should Not Keep Scientific D.student_1_response: I don't think all discoveries should be shared. Businesses, for example, often spend a lot of money on scientific research in order to make a discovery that can lead to profit. Even if that discovery benefits everyone, the business has a right to keep the discovery secret so that it can develop a profitable product from the research. Sharing knowledge is crucially important to most scientists. Scientists usually publish the details of their discoveries in scientific journals, which means that everyone can see what the scientists have accomplished. Being recognized as the person who made a discovery is the biggest reward for any scientist. When scientists keep their discoveries secret, they lose that recognition. That is very unsatisfying.
Governments Should Not Keep Scientific D.student_2_response: In my opinion, I believe that governments and businesses all over the world should share their scientific discoveries with each other. To begin with, the action of sharing scientific information would contribute to a faster development of the whole society. Many scientists would spend numerous hours working in their labs to conduct research and wait for the results; however, if other researchers have already finished the same kind of experiment upon the same subjects, it would save other scientists a great deal of time if the outcome of the experiment is to be shared. Therefore, all scientists could have more time focusing on more pressing subjects and topics. Second, such behavior would also encourage more people to participate in the scientific world, since a lot of data and key information are easily available in the shared community.
Governments Should Not Keep Scientific D.folder_name: Governments Should Not Keep Scientific Discoveries Secret
Governments Should Not Keep Scientific D.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Why People Choose to Live in Rural Areas.topic: Why People Choose to Live in Rural Areas
Why People Choose to Live in Rural Areas.professor_prompt: As part of our module on urbanization and rural-to-urban migration, we are examining factors that influence where people choose to live. Many people migrate from rural areas to cities for economic reasons. However, some continue living in rural areas despite fewer job opportunities. For this discussion, please explain in a post what you think are the main reasons people choose to live in rural areas rather than moving to urban areas.
Why People Choose to Live in Rural Areas.student_1_response: I believe a major reason some people choose to live in rural areas rather than urban centers is the quieter, slower-paced lifestyle. Rural living typically has less noise from traffic and crowds. The quiet allows more relaxation and connection with nature. The less hurried pace of rural life appeals to those wanting to escape the stress of urban environments.
Why People Choose to Live in Rural Areas.student_2_response: I think a major appeal of living in rural areas is the natural environment and air quality. The air tends to be cleaner and fresher with less pollution from factories, cars, and high population density. For people who value the ability to breathe fresh air, grow gardens, and spend time outdoors, rural living provides a healthier lifestyle. The scenic, less-congested environment offers a higher quality of life that can outweigh economic factors for some.
Why People Choose to Live in Rural Areas.folder_name: Why People Choose to Live in Rural Areas
Why People Choose to Live in Rural Areas.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Environmental Tax on Air Travel.professor_prompt: This week, we'll be discussing ways to address air pollution. One idea is introducing environmental taxes on air travel. Such taxes, also referred to as ecological taxes or green taxes, are extra charges that get added to the price of airplane tickets. Money collected from these taxes could be invested in environmentally friendly technologies or in promoting other, cleaner modes of transportation. Do you think there should be an environmental tax on air travel? Why or why not?
Environmental Tax on Air Travel.student_1_response: We should impose environmental taxes on air travel. These taxes might encourage people to find cheaper, more eco-friendly ways to get places. In my country, many people use planes to fly a short distance because flights are relatively cheap, when they could just as easily take a less polluting form of transportation.
Environmental Tax on Air Travel.student_2_response: Additional taxes on air travel will do little to solve the problem of air pollution. Airplane tickets would become more expensive, punishing passengers without incentivizing airlines to become more environmentally friendly. The airlines should pay the price to protect the environment, not their customers.
Environmental Tax on Air Travel.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Spending Time with A Close-knit Few Or A.professor_prompt: Let's explore the dynamics of social interactions and their impact on our well-being. Socializing in smaller groups versus larger circles can have varying effects on one's health and happiness. Some argue that smaller groups foster deeper connections, allowing for more meaningful interactions and a sense of closeness. Conversely, larger friend circles offer diversity and exposure to different perspectives. Which do you think contributes more to a person's health and happiness: spending time with a close-knit few or a larger group of friends?
Spending Time with A Close-knit Few Or A.student_1_response: Developing strong bonds with a few close friends fosters deeper connections and enhances emotional support. These intimate relationships often lead to increased trust and understanding, allowing for genuine empathy and shared experiences. Small friend groups offer a sense of security and authenticity in interactions, promoting mental well-being. For me, a closer, smaller social circle is better. The first reason is that small social circles foster close emotion supports. In a large social group, since everyone has to maintain their relationship with other group members, the opportunity of close communication between each team members will be very small. As a result, close emotional connection are not likely to form between team members in a large team. However, in a small social group, each team member will have enough time and chance to understand others, and whenever who needs an emotional support, other members could easily help him or her. In addition, living in a smaller group is more relaxing. Since we only need to contact a few members in a small social circle, the pressure of living in that group will be much less comparing to a large group, and we will be more relaxed as well.
Spending Time with A Close-knit Few Or A.student_2_response: Having a wide circle of friends offers diverse perspectives and experiences, enriching one's social life. Numerous friendships provide a larger support network, creating opportunities for various activities and interests. Engaging with a larger group cultivates adaptability, social skills, and exposure to different cultures or ideas, contributing to personal growth. From my perspective, spending time with a larger group of friends contributes more to a person's health and happiness. The main reason is that larger group of friends creates more chances of sharing activities and obtaining thoughts. Since numerous friendships means numerous different individual thoughts and hobbies, we would expose ourselves to tremendous numbers of diverse communication and party. For instance, I could learn about philosophical ideas from my philosophy major friends or be informed with knowledge of physical perspective from my physics major friends. I could also go hiking with the people I met in a trip, or go fishing with friends known from my fishing class. There are numerous opportunities to try more engagements and gain relaxation. However, only having a small range of friends, our engagement type could be restrained based on the characteristics of few people and would not be that diversified.
Spending Time with A Close-knit Few Or A.folder_name: Spending Time with A Close-knit Few Or A Larger Group of Friends
Spending Time with A Close-knit Few Or A.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

The Most Important Criteria for Promotio.professor_prompt: As many universities continue to expand their online course offerings, there has been considerable debate about whether online education can truly match the value of traditional in-person learning. Some educators argue that online courses provide greater flexibility and accessibility, while others contend that the lack of face-to-face interaction significantly diminishes the educational experience. In your opinion, can online learning be as effective as traditional classroom instruction? Please explain your reasoning and support your position with specific examples.
The Most Important Criteria for Promotio.student_1_response: I believe online learning can be just as effective as traditional classroom instruction, if not more so in certain respects. The flexibility allows students to learn at their own pace and review materials as needed. Additionally, online courses often incorporate interactive elements like discussion forums and video demonstrations that can enhance understanding. Many students, particularly working adults, would not have access to quality education without online options.
The Most Important Criteria for Promotio.student_2_response: While online learning offers convenience, I argue that it cannot fully replace traditional classroom instruction. The interpersonal dynamics and spontaneous discussions that occur in person are essential to deep learning. Students benefit from immediate feedback and the ability to ask questions in real-time. Furthermore, the social aspect of college involves building networks and relationships that are difficult to develop virtually.
The Most Important Criteria for Promotio.folder_name: The Most Important Criteria for Promotion
The Most Important Criteria for Promotio.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Online Shopping Is Affecting Society？.topic: Online Shopping and Its Effect on Society
Online Shopping Is Affecting Society？.professor_prompt: More and more, online shopping is becoming the primary way that many people obtain everyday goods. But what are the ramifications for the society in which we live? On the one hand, online shopping has advantages -for example, I can make a purchase without ever leaving my home. However, with fewer people shopping at local shops, in some places, these establishments are having a hard time competing. Do you think that online shopping is, on the whole, affecting society?
Online Shopping Is Affecting Society？.student_1_response: I think that online shopping has had negative impacts on society. In my city, many local stores have shelves filled with various products that you can find in online stores. This has forced some of them to close down, which not only affects the amount of tax revenue generated in our local community but also impacts the number of job opportunities available to the community members.
Online Shopping Is Affecting Society？.student_2_response: It's unfortunate that some local stores are forced to close down, but that's the nature of competition. As consumers, we benefit greatly from online shopping due to lower prices. Even if I find a physical store that can compete with online sellers in terms of pricing, I am still likely to make the purchase online because it means I don't have to spend money on transportation to the store. From my point of view, online shopping has a positive influence on society overall. First of all, online shopping can enhance the economy. Online shopping allows customers to make purchases at their home rather than going to shops in person, and people will be more motivated to buy products online since the effort they need to spend on taking a walk to shops is saved. As a result, the economy will be enhanced by the online shopping services. For instance, readers may be reluctant to buy new books that are sold only in bookstores that are far away from them, but problems like that won't exist if they could buy them online. In addition, online shopping can save time for people. Since they don't need to travel to the physical stores to buy products, the time on the road will be saved, which will allow people to spend more time on other things, including academic works or pursuing their own interests.
Online Shopping Is Affecting Society？.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Using Cash to Make Purchase.professor_prompt: We are discussing recent trends in consumer behavior. One trend is a decrease in the use of cash money. Consumers don't use physical money to pay for things as much as they used to. Online shopping has a big impact on this. But even when shopping in person, more people are using credit cards, cash cards, and phone apps to make purchases. So do you think the decrease in using cash is positive or negative? Why?
Using Cash to Make Purchase.student_1_response: I think it's great. I avoid using physical money. The main reason is that I don't want to carry around a wallet stuffed with paper bills and coins. I carry my mobile phone with me anyway, so why carry two things when I only need one? Using my phone to pay for things in the store is a huge convenience.
Using Cash to Make Purchase.student_2_response: I think it's negative. It's easier to keep track of your spending when you use cash. When paying with cards or phone apps, it's easy to ignore how much you spend and go over your budget. But with physical money, you are more aware of your spending, and if you run out of cash, you can't spend any more! Moreover, putting all the money on apps or cards would have risks. Due to the development of technology, online scamming is getting more and more popular. People could be hacked or accidentally leaking their personal information, which could cause them to lose all their money because of that. This could be very damaging to one's mental and physical well-being.
Using Cash to Make Purchase.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Celebrities or Ordinary People Taking ab.topic: Advertising Strategies: Celebrities vs Ordinary People
Celebrities or Ordinary People Taking ab.professor_prompt: This week in class we are learning about different methods of advertising and their effectiveness. One advertising strategy that companies often use is to ask celebrities, famous entertainers, or sports figures to promote their products. However, some experts believe that it is more effective to have ordinary people talk about the product. Which of these two advertising strategies do you think is better?
Celebrities or Ordinary People Taking ab.student_1_response: I like the "ordinary people" approach. People are more interested in a product when they see people like themselves using the product. I think this is even true for clothing advertisements, which traditionally use famous models. People get a better idea of whether they like the clothes when they see all kinds of different people wearing them, and not just models.
Celebrities or Ordinary People Taking ab.student_2_response: I agree with Paul's point of view over this matter. Of course, it is effective to get celebrities or famous entertainers to advocate or endorse a product, because these people are always well recognized and very influential. However, getting ordinary people to talk about a product can be very influential as well. When people see others like themselves discussing a product authentically, they tend to trust the recommendation more. Ordinary people represent the average consumer, which makes the product more relatable and accessible to the target audience.
Celebrities or Ordinary People Taking ab.folder_name: Celebrities or Ordinary People Taking about Products as Advertising Strategies
Celebrities or Ordinary People Taking ab.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Spend More Money on Art+Music Museums, O.topic: Government Spending on Arts vs Public Facilities
Spend More Money on Art+Music Museums, O.professor_prompt: Today, we're going to discuss whether or not the government should spend more money on supporting the arts, such as art and music museums, than on public facilities like playgrounds and public swimming pools. On one hand, investing in the arts can have many benefits for society, such as promoting creativity, cultural awareness, and preserving history. On the other hand, there are concerns about the high cost of supporting the arts, and the argument that funding should be directed towards more practical and tangible improvements for the community, such as improving public facilities and infrastructure. What do you think? Should the government spend more money on art and music museums than on facilities like playgrounds and public swimming pools? Why or why not?
Spend More Money on Art+Music Museums, O.student_1_response: From my perspective, the money should be spent on facilities like playgrounds and public swimming pools. The main reason is that such fund would generate economic benefit. Nowadays, facilities are considered as one of the most imperative factors when it comes to the choice of residence. Many people would choose the city with premium facilities as their ideal living place because those facilities could guarantee living standard. If the government provides fund to a city's facility, it would make the city a tremendously appealing place to work and live, attracting sufficient labors to promote local economy. Besides, the increasing quality of facilities may improve tourism, further developing economic growth. On the contrary, funding art museums may not have such an obvious impact on the economy, since fewer people are interested in arts due to the higher level of pressure that people bear in modern life.
Spend More Money on Art+Music Museums, O.student_2_response: In my opinion, the government should allocate more funding to art and music museums rather than playgrounds and swimming pools. The primary reason is that museums play a crucial role in preserving our cultural heritage and history for future generations. Art and music museums house priceless collections that teach us about our ancestors, different civilizations, and the evolution of human creativity. Without proper funding, these invaluable artifacts could deteriorate or be lost forever. Additionally, museums provide unique educational opportunities that playgrounds and swimming pools cannot offer. Schools frequently organize field trips to museums to expose students to art, history, and culture, which broadens their perspectives and nurtures appreciation for the arts. While playgrounds and swimming pools certainly have value for physical recreation, the intangible benefits of cultural enrichment and education that museums provide are far more significant and lasting for society as a whole.
Spend More Money on Art+Music Museums, O.folder_name: Spend More Money on Art+Music Museums, Or Playgrounds and Public Swimming Pools
Spend More Money on Art+Music Museums, O.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

The Most Important Action for Leaders to.professor_prompt: As you will read in your textbook this week, a country's leaders have many responsibilities in governing. One of these responsibilities is ensuring the economic success or prosperity of the country. But there are always disagreements about the best way to achieve this. What one action do you believe would be the most important for your country's leaders to take to improve the country's economic prosperity? Why?
The Most Important Action for Leaders to.student_1_response: In my country, we don't grow enough of our own crops, so our citizens rely too much on imported food. And that can be costly, especially for families who have many other expenses. I think my country's leaders should improve agricultural capacities so our people and our country as a whole can be more prosperous.
The Most Important Action for Leaders to.student_2_response: My country's leaders need to make housing more affordable. Housing options are currently limited, and the housing that is available often costs too much. Government leaders should encourage more housing to be developed so homes are less expensive to own. Then people would have more money to spend on goods and services, which would help the economy.
The Most Important Action for Leaders to.folder_name: The Most Important Action for Leaders to Improve Country's Prosperity
The Most Important Action for Leaders to.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Government Should Charge Drivers Fees fo.topic: Government Should Charge Drivers Fees for Driving during Rush Hour
Government Should Charge Drivers Fees fo.professor_prompt: To deal with traffic problems during rush hours, governments have to think over solutions to reduce so many cars on the road. Whether governments should charge drivers for certain amount of fees (taxes) to drive during rush hours?
Government Should Charge Drivers Fees fo.student_1_response: In my opinion, governments should not charge drivers additional fees to drive during rush hours. Imposing such financial burdens on citizens, especially during peak commuting times, would create significant economic disadvantage for many working families. Many employees have no choice but to drive to work early in the morning or late in the evening, and adding extra costs would simply punish those who rely on their vehicles for livelihood. Furthermore, such policies would disproportionately affect lower-income workers who cannot afford alternative transportation options. Instead of penalizing drivers, governments should focus on improving public transportation infrastructure and expanding road capacity to genuinely address congestion issues.
Government Should Charge Drivers Fees fo.student_2_response: As far as I'm concerned, governments should charge drivers for certain amount of fees to drive during rush hours. To begin with, as is known to all, traffic congestion is a serious social problem nowadays and many drivers are stuck on the road for a long time. By setting such a rule, many people will consider a lot before deciding whether they will drive their private cars or not. In this way, many citizens, especially the relatively less wealthy ones, will probably select an alternate way of transportation, such as the subway, due to their heavy financial burden. Moreover, the governments can earn money to solve the rushing hour problem more directly. For example, the government can use their budget to build additional roads in the city to support multiple choices for drivers in order to relieve traffic congestion.
Government Should Charge Drivers Fees fo.folder_name: Government Should Charge Drivers Fees for Driving during Rush Hour？
Government Should Charge Drivers Fees fo.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Being An Early Adopter.professor_prompt: Today, we are going to discuss how successful software and tech products are launched and marketed. When companies launch and market these products, early adopters are important. Early adopters are customers who tend to buy the latest products and like to be the first to try out new features and processes. In today's discussion, I would like you to describe at least one advantage or disadvantage of being an early adopter. Please explain why you think this way.
Being An Early Adopter.student_1_response: One obvious disadvantage is that early adopters probably pay a lot more for brand-new technology. When products first come out, they're often quite expensive, but once they've been on the market for a while, the price usually drops. That's why I usually wait to buy new technology.
Being An Early Adopter.student_2_response: New tech products might not always be more expensive—sometimes the company will give people a new product at a discount in exchange for trying it out and giving feedback on it. In fact, to me, that's the biggest advantage of being an early adopter—your feedback can guide future improvements to a product. That's a powerful feeling.
Being An Early Adopter.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Why People Choose Not To Help Others - I.topic: Why People Choose Not To Help Others - Inaction
Why People Choose Not To Help Others - I.professor_prompt: One social phenomenon we discussed recently is this: when a person is in some trouble, some people help that person, while many others do nothing. Some people conclude that inaction— that is, doing nothing—makes the world a worse place. In your post, please discuss the causes or the effects of this social phenomenon; in other words, what are some reasons why people might choose not to help others, or what are some results of this inaction?
Why People Choose Not To Help Others - I.student_1_response: In my opinion, one of the main causes behind this phenomenon of people not helping others is concern for one's own interests. If I come across someone in a situation who needs help, I will want to help that person—but not if it creates some significant problem for me. Doing so will simply put us both in a bad situation.
Why People Choose Not To Help Others - I.student_2_response: I agree that inaction makes the world worse. That means that we all have the responsibility to make the world a better place. An important effect of people not taking on this responsibility is that we may feel less trusting of our neighbors. Conversely, when others show that they are willing to help people, our community becomes stronger. In my opinion, I believe there are several reasons why people nowadays might not be willing to help others. First, helping other people might cause unnecessary trouble for us. For example, many commuters might have to reach their destination as soon as possible in the morning, but if they see someone in need on the street and choose to help them, such as giving other people a ride, they might have to face the consequence of being late for their work or other important matter. Second, some urgent situation might demand professional people to deal with, and it might be the best option for common people not intervene. For example, if a person suddenly experiences a heart attack, what he or she really needs is a professional doctor or people equipped with medical knowledge. Only people who understand how to do CPR could save that person. As a result, many people might not choose to help even if their inaction might delay the best timing of saving that person.
Why People Choose Not To Help Others - I.folder_name: Why People Choose Not To Help Others - Inaction
Why People Choose Not To Help Others - I.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Using A Mobile App to Learn A Foreign La.topic: Using Mobile Apps to Learn a Foreign Language
Using A Mobile App to Learn A Foreign La.professor_prompt: This week we talked about the role of mobile applications or apps in learning a foreign language. We learned that some people believe that they get so much benefit from using a mobile app that they see no need to use any other method, such as attending a class led by a teacher. Others believe that using only a mobile app is not a very effective way to learn a foreign language well. In this discussion post, I would like you to indicate which of those views you support, and why.
Using A Mobile App to Learn A Foreign La.student_1_response: In my opinion, I believe that learning a foreign language only on a mobile app is not an effective way. To begin with, this lack of communication with people who are fluent could cause a hard time for people to understand the idioms. In a language, people would have to create their own idiom to describe things or to communicate efficiently. Talking to a person who is fluent in that language for example their teachers, could help people to better understand that culture and pick up different idioms during the conversation. However, if people just study it on a phone, they would have a hard time linking it to the knowledge they already have. Admittedly, it is true that people could learn all those vocabularies and grammar online easily, but it would be harder for them to remember comparing to having a class. Furthermore, many apps might contain errors that could cause a misunderstanding of knowledge. Nowadays, even the most well-developed app could have errors and bugs, which could decrease the quality and efficiency of learning the target language.
Using A Mobile App to Learn A Foreign La.student_2_response: An integral part of language learning from my point of view is practice, and what better way to practice than in a class, with classmates and a teacher? My classmates will probably all be at a similar proficiency level as me and are just as motivated as me to learn the language. I believe that mobile applications are probably the way to go when it comes to language learning. I do see the points made by my peer, but for me, the benefits of mobile apps are way better. For example, using a mobile app allows you to learn at your own convenience without the limitations of time and location that often characterize learning in a classroom with a teacher.
Using A Mobile App to Learn A Foreign La.folder_name: Using A Mobile App to Learn A Foreign Language
Using A Mobile App to Learn A Foreign La.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Factories Or Individuals to Make Efforts.professor_prompt: Some argue that factories, as major producers of pollution and waste, should be pushed to make dramatic changes in how they operate in order to protect and preserve the environment. Others contend that it is the small, cumulative actions of individuals that lead to the greatest impact, so public awareness and altered societal norms are most critical. I would like you to consider: who do you believe should make more efforts when it comes to environmental protection - factories or individuals?
Factories Or Individuals to Make Efforts.student_1_response: Factories should take the lead on protecting the environment because their impact is massive compared to individuals. For example, a single factory can generate tons of pollution per day, dwarfing what one person produces in a lifetime. Strict regulations and greener technologies for manufacturers would lead to huge reductions in emissions and waste.
Factories Or Individuals to Make Efforts.student_2_response: Individuals should lead on environmental protection because we can drive cultural change. By making green lifestyle choices - reducing energy, taking public transit, minimizing waste - we set an example and normalize sustainability. And by purchasing eco-products and ethical companies, everyday consumer decisions incentivize businesses to follow suit.
Factories Or Individuals to Make Efforts.folder_name: Factories Or Individuals to Make Efforts for Environmental Protection
Factories Or Individuals to Make Efforts.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Customer Reviews for Deciding Buying Pro.professor_prompt: We are looking this week at different ways businesses market their products and services, especially nontraditional methods. One thing that marketers pay close attention to is online reviews of their products. A business might include customer reviews on their website or carefully monitor the reviews on third-party sites. I would like you to discuss your own experiences with online reviews. Do you find them useful when deciding whether or not to buy a product or service?
Customer Reviews for Deciding Buying Pro.student_1_response: I think online reviews are a great source of information because they are written by ordinary customers who are like me. For instance, when I read a restaurant review by a professional food critic, I'm not interested in some of the details that are included, like how the food is prepared. I'm more interested in aspects like the quality of the food and the service, which regular customers usually comment on.
Customer Reviews for Deciding Buying Pro.student_2_response: To me, online reviews have some real problems. First, people are more likely to post reviews after a bad experience than after a good one. As a result, what you read is often weighted toward the negative. Also, you have no way of knowing whether reviewers know what they are talking about or even if they actually bought and used the product they are reviewing.
Customer Reviews for Deciding Buying Pro.folder_name: Customer Reviews for Deciding Buying Products
Customer Reviews for Deciding Buying Pro.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

To-do Lists Are Beneficial Tools for Lea.topic: To-do Lists Are Beneficial Tools for Learning and Working
To-do Lists Are Beneficial Tools for Lea.professor_prompt: This week, we talked about strategies for planning our work effectively. One strategy is the to-do list, which is a list of tasks that must be accomplished daily or weekly. Some people believe to-do lists are extremely helpful, while others believe they can cause us to be overwhelmed and lose focus on what is really important. In this discussion, share your view about using time-management strategies such as to-do lists: How helpful are they for your work or studies? Why?
To-do Lists Are Beneficial Tools for Lea.student_1_response: I can't function without to-do lists. I outline what my plan is every day because it helps me clarify what my goals are for the day. This provides the clear structure that I need to be productive. The best part of my day is when I check off my accomplishments at the end of the day and celebrate my small achievements.
To-do Lists Are Beneficial Tools for Lea.student_2_response: It's interesting how things work differently for different people. I find to-do lists very unproductive because I usually overload my to-do lists with a lot of tasks and end up completing only a few items from the list. This makes me less motivated for the next day.
To-do Lists Are Beneficial Tools for Lea.folder_name: To-do Lists Are Beneficial Tools for Learning and Working？
To-do Lists Are Beneficial Tools for Lea.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

What Companies Can Do To Be Attractive t.topic: Companies Attracting Potential Employees / Labor Shortages
What Companies Can Do To Be Attractive t.professor_prompt: This week we are discussing labor shortages. That's when there are more jobs in the economy than there are qualified people to fill those jobs. During a labor shortage, companies have to compete with one another to attract people to work for them. In your online discussion, please explain what you think companies can do to make themselves more attractive to potential employees.
What Companies Can Do To Be Attractive t.student_1_response: I think one thing that makes a company attractive is location. When companies choose a location for a facility, they should think about whether it's a place that employees want to be. For example, locating a workplace in a big city where there are lots of shops and entertainment options could be a good way to attract new employees. It might sound unimportant at first, but I have heard of companies that provide their employees with a variety of food options in their facility. These companies don't just have a cafeteria; they also provide coffee bars and free snack stations for their employees to make working there more enjoyable. I think this also makes employees feel appreciated.
What Companies Can Do To Be Attractive t.student_2_response: In my opinion, I believe that in order for a company to be attractive, it should develop a better working condition for the employees. First, comfortable working condition could help to increase their satisfaction level. For many people nowadays, earning money is no longer the essential goal, when they reach a certain income level the satisfaction they could get from the job is the one that matters. By increasing the working condition, the hygiene factor would be achieved, leading to greater happiness of the employees. The employees would also compare the working environment of all those companies when the salaries they receive is the same amount as from the company with better working condition would be more attractive. Furthermore, having this good working environment could help the old employees to give compliments to the company. When the old employees are satisfied of the working condition they would more likely to suggest the company to other people. This could also cause an increase in the chance of attracting potential employees.
What Companies Can Do To Be Attractive t.folder_name: What Companies Can Do To Be Attractive to Potential Employees
What Companies Can Do To Be Attractive t.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

The Biggest Disadvantage of Starting One.topic: Disadvantages of Starting One's Own Business
The Biggest Disadvantage of Starting One.professor_prompt: Next week, we will begin our unit on entrepreneurship. Throughout the world, many people are attracted to the idea of starting a business of their own rather than working for an employer. Naturally, there are benefits to being an entrepreneur, but there are also drawbacks that are important to consider. In your opinion, what is the biggest disadvantage of starting one's own business? Why do you think so?
The Biggest Disadvantage of Starting One.student_1_response: Starting a business often requires a significant sacrifice of time. There is so much that goes into establishing a company or setting up a shop. And even when the business is operational, the work for the owner never ends. Business owners are constantly worried about growing the business and seeking out opportunities.
The Biggest Disadvantage of Starting One.student_2_response: I think the biggest disadvantage of starting a business is that it can be a burden to be in a leadership position on one's own. Most people decide to work in organizations with predictable responsibilities, and they have supervisors who can guide them in problem solving and decision making. Entrepreneurs must figure things out for themselves and are more likely to make mistakes.
The Biggest Disadvantage of Starting One.folder_name: The Biggest Disadvantage of Starting One's Own Business
The Biggest Disadvantage of Starting One.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Automation.professor_prompt: Automation is a much-discussed topic in economics, one that continues to grow in importance with today's advances in robotics and artificial intelligence, or AI. Robots and AI provide powerful ways to replace human labor by doing work better and faster than people can. Automation can have very positive effects on businesses and the broader economy, but there are disadvantages as well. What do you think? Is the use of automation a positive development overall? Why or why not?
Automation.student_1_response: I think the use of automation is a positive development. If AI and robots are used instead of human workers, companies will be able to produce many more products than they do now. They can also lower costs, making those products cheaper for people to buy. As a result, everyone will have access to more-affordable products.
Automation.student_2_response: I worry about the psychological effects on people as AI and robots take over work. I doubt humans will really be happy with ever-greater amounts of leisure time. Many of us derive satisfaction from working and doing our jobs well. In fact, never in human history have we been able to spend large parts of our days labor-free.
Automation.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Improve Schoolteachers' Salaries or Addi.topic: School Budget Allocation: Teachers' Salaries vs. Additional Resources
Improve Schoolteachers' Salaries or Addi.professor_prompt: Today we will discuss a topic that is important for students and the public at large: namely, how to prioritize spending, given the limited funding available for schools. Some people think schools should spend more money on schoolteachers' salaries because, if the salaries improved, more qualified people will be attracted to the profession. Others believe the money should be spent on additional resources such as books and computers. Which viewpoint do you agree with?
Improve Schoolteachers' Salaries or Addi.student_1_response: In my opinion, I believe teacher's salaries should be raised. To begin with, it is known to all that the general salary for teachers is not in the same league as that for other industries such as finance or business. Therefore, many talented people would consider those more profitable occupations when deciding their careers. However, if the overall salary for teachers could be increased, more capable and competitive people would start choosing teachers as their professions. With more experts and professionals in education industry, the quality of students' courses will also be significantly boosted, which would in turn result in better academic performances among students. These students would have a bigger chance to make more valuable contribution to the whole society and make the world a better place. Admittedly, some people believe that spending money on additional resources is a good option, but raising teachers' salaries and encouraging them to do more research and improve their teaching skills would generate far more benefit than buying more advanced computers or books for students.
Improve Schoolteachers' Salaries or Addi.student_2_response: I believe that additional resources for students are more important than raising teachers' salaries. For one thing, many students in schools do not have a good access to a wide range of information due to the lack of proper computers and books. It is the school's duty to install more equipment to facilitate students' studies. For example, students could learn more details about certain animals during biology class if they have a good projector to cast images; they could go comfortably to the schools' libraries to do their researches instead of going to other places if schools have a vast collection of books covering more topics and fields. For another thing, raising teachers' salaries might result in some negative consequence. For instance, some teachers might spend more time pursuing their personal interests rather than focusing on their teaching responsibilities if they are already well-compensated.
Improve Schoolteachers' Salaries or Addi.folder_name: Improve Schoolteachers' Salaries or Additional Resources
Improve Schoolteachers' Salaries or Addi.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Shop at Small Local Stores Or Superstore.topic: Retail Sales: Small Local Stores vs Superstores
Shop at Small Local Stores Or Superstore.professor_prompt: This week, we will be discussing retail sales. One popular model of retail is "superstores"—very large stores, typically owned by corporations—that sell many kinds of different products. We will compare this business model to local retailers, typically small or specialized stores with local owners, such as a camera shop or a small neighborhood grocery store. Do you think it is more beneficial for people to shop at small local stores rather than at superstores? Why or why not?
Shop at Small Local Stores Or Superstore.student_1_response: Shopping at small local stores benefits consumers in many ways. One of the benefits is that small stores often offer better services than large stores. For example, if you need your bicycle repaired, usually the small shop can do it right there in the shop. At the large stores, they have to send it to the manufacturer to be repaired. Although I understand the importance of shopping at small stores to support the local community, there are obvious benefits to shopping at superstores. Because large retailers procure products in bulk, they can offer their customers a wide variety of products, usually at low prices. So, by shopping at large stores, consumers get better value for their money.
Shop at Small Local Stores Or Superstore.student_2_response: From my perspective, I don't think it's more beneficial for people to shop at small local stores rather than at superstores. To begin with, the local supermarket usually closes early, so its opening hours are not long enough to meet the requirements of most people. For instance, small local supermarkets are usually run by individuals, so we cannot guarantee that the shops will be open all day. Although some small supermarkets have a better service, just imagine, when we go to the small stores at midnight with no one to help, it would be even more inconvenient. In contrast, superstores not only operate all day, but also help us solve problems better since they have more staff to provide necessary aid for consumers. On top of that, superstores usually have a variety of goods. When people shop in a large supermarket, they usually buy more than they need to use. In that case, it decreases the number of times they go shopping, thus, reducing their chances of driving and reducing air pollution.
Shop at Small Local Stores Or Superstore.folder_name: Shop at Small Local Stores Or Superstores
Shop at Small Local Stores Or Superstore.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Do many possissions actually drecrease q.topic: Material Possessions and Quality of Life
Do many possissions actually drecrease q.professor_prompt: While owning lots of consumer products is believed to increase the quality of life, these products can also impose responsibilities on those who own them. For example, electronic devices, appliances, and vehicles require constant attention and regular maintenance. Possessions also need to be stored and organized, taking up time and space. For these reasons, some people argue that having many possessions can actually decrease the quality of life. Do you agree or disagree? Why?
Do many possissions actually drecrease q.student_1_response: I totally agree that an excess of possessions can drag down our quality of life. Just think about the time we spend organizing closets or garages. I spend hours every month sorting and storing clothes in my closet. This clutter and the time it takes to manage it can become overwhelming and detract from enjoying life.
Do many possissions actually drecrease q.student_2_response: Just the thought of having to constantly worry about my gadgets, or even my car, needing maintenance gives me anxiety. It's like adding extra homework to life. Life often requires owning many things, but personally, I hate having to keep track of them all or worry about them getting damaged or stolen. The mental burden of maintaining possessions takes away from the joy they are supposed to bring.
Do many possissions actually drecrease q.folder_name: Do many possissions actually drecrease quality of life
Do many possissions actually drecrease q.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Social Media Influencers.professor_prompt: This week, we discussed the importance of role models and opinion makers in society. One idea we discussed was the widespread impact of 'influencers.' Influencers are people who are very active posting on social media and who have many followers. Influencers' posts and opinions can influence their followers' choices on everything from fashion to politics. In your opinion, do social media influencers generally have a positive or negative effect on their followers? Why do you think so?
Social Media Influencers.student_1_response: In my point of view, social media influencers have largely created negative impacts on society as well as their followers. To start with, being a social media influencer means that they have to gain enough network traffic from users, so that they could sell products through their accounts. However, in order to gain such online exposure, some influencers might choose to display some reckless or even aggressive behaviors. For example, they might choose to record videos of fighting with people randomly on the street; or they might do some illegal things while doing livestreaming, such like a big livestreaming scandal uncovered in South Korea last year, where people were being manipulated. Such things would create terrible influence on the whole society. For instance, some young adolescents might imitate such course of actions with a false hope of making money or becoming famous, which would in turn create turmoil and instability in the community.
Social Media Influencers.student_2_response: I think the influencers' effect is generally positive. People can learn about the latest trends and topics in a very quick and efficient way by following influencers. In the past, people had to spend time looking through magazines or visiting boutiques to even know what was trending. Additionally, many influencers use their platform for good causes. They often participate in charity or government projects to bring awareness to important social issues. They also encourage people to get involved in their communities and share the experience of becoming more active citizens. While it is true that some influencers might do inappropriate things for more exposure and attention, I believe that platforms could implement strict laws and regulations to prevent such behaviors.
Social Media Influencers.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Four-day Workweek.professor_prompt: In many countries, the standard workweek consists of eight hours of work each day for five days per week. Now, though, some people advocate a shorter workweek: a four-day workweek with no decrease in workers' pay. There are advantages and disadvantages to this, of course. What is your opinion about instituting a shorter, four-day workweek, and why?
Four-day Workweek.student_1_response: I like that idea, but on one condition: that the workday is no longer than eight hours. I have heard some plans require ten hours a day for a four-day week. Most employees would find that exhausting, and it could actually be counterproductive to tire out your workers. Yes to four-day weeks, but no to ten-hour days!
Four-day Workweek.student_2_response: I totally agree with the idea of having a four-day workweek. To begin with, shorter working hours can give people time to relax and promote the happiness index of residents in such a stressful world. Personally, I will choose to spend that spare time with my family or devote it for my hobbies, and doing this will surely ease my anxiety. Moreover, it will also promote a relaxed atmosphere in the workplace leading to a better work experience and results. Some people might say doing the same amount of work within four days will cause an increase on people's working pressure on every single work day. However, the four-day workweek will lead to a higher working efficiency on each work day. And efficiency is what people admire the most in such high pace world life, not to mention the pressure mentioned above can be easily compensated by the weekend with an extra day.
Four-day Workweek.remediation_logs: Aggregated across multiple images. LLM filled in missing components.

Space Exploration.professor_prompt: All governments must make difficult decisions about how to spend their money and which projects to prioritize in place of others. For example, some governments have programs that focus on space exploration. They spend great sums of money to train astronauts and build spacecraft that can travel beyond Earth's atmosphere. Do you think that space exploration is a good use of a government's money and resources? Why or why not?
Space Exploration.student_1_response: I don't think space exploration is a good use of public funds. I've noticed that sometimes when a government introduces a new spacecraft, it has years of technical difficulties or fails to reach its destination. That's quite a waste of years of work and money.
